reviews.text: Rooms will big but not well maintain. But hotel staff will super helpfull and polite. Told them abt leaking aircon they sent help immediately. The swimming pool was big and nice place  to chill at rooftop, thus can get a tan. Hotel is near to so many Food tat u eat till you explode ha ha ha.

Staff is good but unfortunately I book the same days when it had an event in the hotel. The people from Indonesia came here and let the children play together in the hall way and very noisy

Not quiet at all. People always slam the door you can hear that.

But overall is good enough

The hotel is very dated, very old, and very mildewy. Air condition did not work well. Hotel only gave out one key to open door (key, not key card). Very noisy at night. I could hear footsteps, talking and outside noise through the night. Close to food spots but mostly Muslim food. I’ve stayed at 2 star hotels that were better than Hotel 81 Tristar. Do not recommend. 3/10. Overpriced for a dingy hotel.

Basic rooms which are quite big and quite clean. Pool is very shallow i.e. 1m deep, but with good opening ours from 7 am - 9pm. Location is 15 minute walk from the Paya Lebar Metro station from which you can go in 30 minutes either downtown or to e.g. the expo.

Overall a good value for the price.

We stayed here for our first night in Singapore.
The staff was incredible and offered very helpful advice for us first timers.
Sarinah and Vicki were an absolute delight at the front desk. What a way to start our trip!
